thread.title: Bill Belichick loves his 'No days off!' chant, but the NFLPA isn't amused
thread.title_full: Bill Belichick loves his 'No days off!' chant, but the NFLPA isn't amused

author: Brandon Schlager (bschlager@sportingnews.com)
title: Bill Belichick loves his 'No days off!' chant, but the NFLPA isn't amused
text:
February 7, 2017 10:54pm   10:52pm EST American Football, News, English, NFL, New England Patriots, Bill Belichick Ironically, most of Boston took the day off from work Tuesday to attend the Patriots' Super Bowl parade. Bill Belichick (Getty Images) 
Updated at 10:54 p.m. ET 
Updated at 10:54 p.m. ET 
It isn't often Bill BelichickÂ inspires emotion, at least not publicly. Maybe there's a reason for that.Â 
The prickly Patriots coach broke characterÂ Tuesday as the Boston masses gathered to celebrate a fifth Super Bowl championship and let loose during his speech.. 
MORE:Â Beer-spiking Gronk, dabbing little Brady highlight Patriots parade 
Decidedly pumped,Â BelichickÂ applaudedÂ his players' work ethic. "No days off!" he shouted to the thousands of Patriots fans, most havingÂ gathered, ironically, after they'dÂ taken theÂ day off from work to attend the rally. BelichickÂ paused a momentÂ for the half-hearted cheer, then, with grimacing players on either side, attempted to lead the most awkwardÂ chant you'll ever see. Here's Bill Belichick starting a chant ... or at least trying to? pic.twitter.com/x2tbIonilG â SB Nation (@SBNation) February 7, 2017 
Who knows? Maybe Patriots fans were more fired up than they let on. 
It certainly caught the attention of the NFL Players' Association, which didn't seem entirely amused. I'ma let you finish, Coach, but we're pretty sure the CBA says otherwise đ¤ https://t.co/9nVPmlqVq5 â NFLPA (@NFLPA) February 7, 2017 
Of course, the NFL's collective bargaining agreement mandates players are allowedÂ some days off during the season. No need to get into the fine print, though. Watch This
